alert.note: Alert for Brown (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 12:51PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following counties, Brown and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated minor flooding is occurring in North Fork Salt Creek at Nashville and Salt Creek at Harrodsburg. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Bloomington, Nashville, Ellettsville, Woodville Hills, Yellowwood Lake, Unionville, Charles Deam Wilderness, Monroe Reservoir, Lake Lemon, Elkinsville, Helmsburg, Smithville, Indiana University, Story, Fairfax State Recreation Area, Whitehall, Harrodsburg, Stone Head, Gnaw Bone and Spurgeons Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
